roleset.name: make a bicycle go
roleset.note: PEDAL-V NOTES: Frames file for 'pedal' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 51.4.2, Framenet entry Transportation. (from pedal.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: with bicycle
example.text: This place is 12 miles into the back country -- a day-long trudge for a hiker, but reached by [Ms. Peterson and six others]-1 in a mere two hours of *trace*-1 pedaling fat-tired mountain bikes.

example.name: one kind of path
example.text: When they return to their desks at 1 p.m., they have pedaled 20 miles.
example.arg: When they return to their desks at 1 p.m.

example.name: another kind of path
example.text: They wanted a machine that would allow them to pedal into rugged terrain then inaccessible to cycles.
example.arg: into rugged terrain then inaccessible to cycles

example.name: not a path!
example.text: [Bikers -- many of them ardent environmentalists --]-1 proclaim their sport an efficient, safe, fitness-promoting way to get back to nature, while asserting a right, as taxpayers, *trace*-1 to pedal on public lands.
